channel.title: Demos on musing on github.io related to leaflet-map
channel.description: Recent content in Demos on musing on github.io related to leaflet-map

item.title: zero
item.description:
Demo Zero, copied from leaflet-map QuickStart Guide in README.md

  • leaflet-map on Github
  • view source
  • using [branch (leaflet 1.1.0)(https://github.com/leaflet-extras/leaflet-map.git)
    • resulting error (in Chrome Version 45.0.2454.99 (64-bit) on openSuse Tumbleweed)
      • Error: Invalid value for attribute d=“M0,-7.649338877763425e+302A7.649338877763425e+302,7.649338877763425e+302,0,1,1,-0.1,-7.649338877763425e+302 z”
      • from what I dug through this is the result of the SVG intrepeter in Chrome only accepting single precision floats and this contains double precision representations what I haven’t dug into is where the large numbers arise from
      • If the leaflet-circle is removed then the error does not occur but no tiles is displayed
      • Moving the circle from the same location also removes the error (no tiles displayed, beyond zoom?)
  • using branch use_bounds_for_fit_to_markers
    • resulting map

<html> <head> <script type="text/javascript" src="../../bower_components/webcomponentsjs/webcomponents-lite.js"></script> <link rel="import" href="../../bower_components/leaflet-map/leaflet-map.html"> <style> html, body { margin: 0; height: 100%; } leaflet-map { height: 100%; } </style> </head> <body> <leaflet-map fit-to-markers> <leaflet-marker longitude="77.2" latitude="28.4"> Marker I </leaflet-marker> <leaflet-circle longitude="77.2001" latitude="28.4001" radius="300"> Round </leaflet-circle> </leaflet-map> </body> </html>
